casebody.data:
William C. TOWNSEND, Master and Owner of Power Boat VELMA BROOKS, and R. E. Roberts, Trading and Doing Business as Lord-Mott Company, Appellants, v. MUNSON STEAMSHIP LINE, Claimant of Steamship MUNDOLPHIN, Her Engines, etc., Appellee. No. 3544. Circuit Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Oct. 20, 1933. George W. P. Whip, of Baltimore, Md. (Lord & Whip, of Baltimore, Md., on the brief), for appellants. Robert W. Williams, of Baltimore, Md. (Janney, Ober & Williams and William A. Grimes, all of Baltimore, Md., on the brief), for appellee.

Before PARKER, NORTHCOTT, and SOPER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

A careful examination of the record of this case convinces us that the decree below (3 P. Supp. 766) should he affirmed for the reasons stated in the opinion of the District Judge, which is hereby adopted as the opinion of this Court.

Affirmed.
